steps.text: Tom, a meticulous farmer, has segregated his farm produce to sell to the grocers.
Bob seems to have toppled all the baskets, scattering all the produce.
Help Arya put these edible parts of plants back into their respective baskets to save Bob from the farmer’s fury.

question.text: Help Arya put the edible parts of the plants into the appropriate baskets.

feedBack.text: Yay! Radish and turnip are considered roots because they grow under the ground and absorb large amounts of nutrients from the soil.
Onion and ginger are underground parts of the stem that have thickened to store food.
Oops! Onion and ginger are not roots. They have nodes, internodes, buds and scale leaves.
Radish and turnip are not stems as they are not derived from stem tissues.

question.text: Help Arya put the edible parts of the plants into the appropriate baskets.

feedBack.text: Yay! Beet and cauliflower are considered vegetables because they develop from other parts of a plant rather than the ovary and do not contain seeds.
Okra and tomato are considered fruits because they are seed-bearing structures that develop from the ovary of a flowering plant.
Uh-oh! Okra and tomato are not vegetables. They contain seeds and are developed from the ovary.
Beet and cauliflower are not fruits. They do not contain seeds and are developed from other parts of a plant rather than the ovary.

question.text: Help Arya put the edible parts of the plants into the appropriate baskets.

feedBack.text: That’s right! Carrot is an enlarged root that grows below the soil surface, and can absorb nutrients from the soil.
Cabbages are dense, overlapped leaves of a plant that are consumed as food.
Potato tubers are thickened stems that have buds which sprout stems and leaves.
Broccoli is a vegetable that is the flower part of the plant.

Potato and broccoli are not roots or leaves of plants. They are not derived from the tissues constituting the 
roots or leaves.
Carrot and cabbage are not stems or flowers of plants as they are not derived from those plant tissues.

question.text: Help Arya put the edible parts of the plants into the appropriate baskets.

feedBack.text: That’s right! Garlic is a modified stem known as a bulb.
Black peppercorn is a fruit that contains a single seed. It is dried and used for seasoning.
Sweet potato is an enlarged, swollen lateral root that absorbs nutrients from the soil.
Pista is considered as an edible seed that is enclosed within a fruit.
Uh-oh! Pista and sweet potato are not stems or fruits of plants as they are not derived from those plant tissues.
Garlic and blackpepper are not roots or seeds of plants. They are not derived from those plant tissues which make the roots or seeds.

steps.text: Good job! You helped Arya segregate the edible parts of plants to their correct places!
